item.author: LangChain

item.title: Want to use ColBERT with LangChain? This is the easiest way we know of
item.description:
Want to use ColBERT with LangChain? This is the easiest way we know of


Harrison Chase:‚ÄÇI've been wanting to try out ColBERT for a while - and this made it so easy I had no reason not to!

Added a page on how to use RAGatouille in LangChain! The RAGatouille interface lined up nicely with the LangChain one so was quite easy üòé

üëèüëè @bclavie

https://python.langchain.com/docs/integrations/retrievers/ragatouille
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Austin Vance: Just finished a Tutorial on how I built a RAG with @LangChainAI to help me create YouTube descriptions, titles and more. Honestly @La...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇAustin Vance
Just finished a Tutorial on how I built a RAG with @LangChainAI to help me create YouTube descriptions, titles and more.

Honestly @LangChainAI + @OpenAI w/ LCEL make it so easy to build LLM tools small or large.

Give me a ‚ù§Ô∏è / üëç if you like it!

https://youtu.be/DTjj50mfEP8
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Harrison Chase: I've been wanting to try out ColBERT for a while - and this made it so easy I had no reason not to! Added a page on how to use RAGa...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇHarrison Chase
I've been wanting to try out ColBERT for a while - and this made it so easy I had no reason not to!

Added a page on how to use RAGatouille in LangChain! The RAGatouille interface lined up nicely with the LangChain one so was quite easy üòé

üëèüëè @bclavie

https://python.langchain.com/docs/integrations/retrievers/ragatouille


Benjamin Clavi√©:‚ÄÇThe RAG wave is here to stay, but in practice, it's hard to retrieve the right docs w/ embdings, & better IR models are hard to use!

Let's fix that: Introducing ü™§RAGatouille, a lib to train&use SotA retrieval model, ColBERT, in just a few lines of code!
https://github.com/bclavie/RAGatouille
item.author: LangChain

item.description:
üïµÔ∏èLCEL Chain Inspection

Need a better understanding of that long chain?

We've recently added two methods to better inspect ANY chain created with LangChain Expression Language:

üìàView any chain as a graph
üí¨See all the prompts associated with a chain

https://python.langchain.com/docs/expression_language/how_to/inspect

item.title: ‚úÇÔ∏è Information Extraction using LLMs This great blog walks through how to create an app that allows you to: üìÅUpload a file of your choice üß±Spe...
item.description:
‚úÇÔ∏è Information Extraction using LLMs

This great blog walks through how to create an app that allows you to:

üìÅUpload a file of your choice
üß±Specify the schema you want to extract

And then it pulls out all that info!

Blog: https://pub.towardsai.net/demystifying-information-extraction-using-llm-f1a551f01f66

Full code links in blog!
item.author: LangChain

item.title: Our community is awesome! Incredible to see this animation of the LangChain GitHub repository over time Thank you to everyone who shows up!! Can you s...
item.description:
Our community is awesome!

Incredible to see this animation of the LangChain GitHub repository over time

Thank you to everyone who shows up!! Can you spot yourself?


Bassem Dghaidi:‚ÄÇIt's fascinating to see how the @LangChainAI / langchain GitHub repository evolved over time. The power of open source communities is mind boggling. You can also see the explosion in contributions when LLMs became mainstream in 2023.

I generated this with the awesome gource‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1742544697027862947
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT DataCamp: A key application of large language models (LLMs) is the ability to answer questions about specific documents and datasets. In this code-...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇDataCamp
A key application of large language models (LLMs) is the ability to answer questions about specific documents and datasets.

In this code-along, Andrea Valenzuela, Computing Engineer at @CERN, and Josep Ferrer Sanchez, Data Scientist at the @Catalonia_BNL, explore building an AI‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1742881998941646975

RT‚ÄÇDataCamp
New year, new (AI) skills: Learn everything you need to get started with AI‚Äîfor free‚Äîin 1‚Äì2 hour sessions. üí∏

In partnership with @Microsoft, @Pinecone, @Fidelity, and more‚Äîthe AI Developer code-along series is an opportunity to develop vital generative AI skills for 2024.

item.description:
üì∞New Paper Alert: Breast Ultrasound Report Generation using LangChain

This recent paper out of Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology uses LangChain and classical image classification models to help with medical report generation

https://arxiv.org/pdf/2312.03013.pdf

item.title: RT Brace: üß• Cohere RAG Chat API üß• Cohere's API with built in support for RAG is now in @LangChainAI JS! Their chat API comes with out of the box...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇBrace
üß• Cohere RAG Chat API üß•

Cohere's API with built in support for RAG is now in @LangChainAI JS! Their chat API comes with out of the box support for RAG and searching the web with zero extra configuration necessary!

You can download this standalone package to interact with‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1742606802586566849
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Jacob Lee: üåê Tavily Search Tool for Agents üåê You can now use @tavilyai, a search engine built specifically for AI agents, as a tool in @LangC...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇJacob Lee
üåê Tavily Search Tool for Agents üåê

You can now use @tavilyai, a search engine built specifically for AI agents, as a tool in @LangChainAI JS/TS community 0.0.13!

Try for free and give your agents the most up-to-date information possible:

https://js.langchain.com/docs/integrations/tools/tavily_search

item.description:
RT‚ÄÇPulumi
Did you know Pulumi has a ü§ñ AI / ML Essentials playlist? You can watch videos on how to create a chatbot, using @OpenAI, @huggingface, and also presentations and workshops on topics including @LangChainAI, @pinecone, @Docker and others.

Watch it at https://hubs.ly/Q02dCLTL0

item.description:
‚ùìThe Question Improver Agent

This agent by @sockcymbal is an LLM-driven "tool for thought" designed to elevate the quality and depth of user-posed questions

ü•áIt won 1st place at the AI for Thought Hackathon at @AGIHouseSF

It has some great prompts!

https://github.com/sockcymbal/QuestionImprover

item.description:
RT‚ÄÇwasmedge
Merged! You can now use WasmEdge as a highly efficient and cross-platform LLM backend for @LangChainAI ‚Äî using any open source model on any device!

https://github.com/langchain-ai/langchain/pull/14787

Thanks to @sam_xliu for making this contribution!

Unlock API intelligence!

item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Riad: "OpenGPTs" from @LangChainAI seems to be the closest to what I was looking for Thanks @gilhildebrand for letting me know about it
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇRiad
"OpenGPTs" from @LangChainAI seems to be the closest to what I was looking for

Thanks @gilhildebrand for letting me know about it


Riad:‚ÄÇDoes anyone know if such a tool exists?

I'd like to create custom GPTs augmented with files and/or vector databases, and I'd like it to work with any OS LLM I choose, all this in local on my own GPU
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Jacob Lee: ‚ú® Cohere Beta Chat models ‚ú® You can now use @cohere‚Äôs beta chat interface with @LangChainAI JS/TS via a new langchain/cohere package!...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇJacob Lee
‚ú® Cohere Beta Chat models ‚ú®

You can now use @cohere‚Äôs beta chat interface with @LangChainAI JS/TS via a new langchain/cohere package!

It supports streaming and their completions + embeddings models too.

Why not kick off 2024 with a new model:

https://js.langchain.com/docs/integrations/chat/cohere
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Tiernan Ray: How LangChain turns GenAI into a genuinely useful assistant The age of AI agents may start with stringing together simple modules that...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇTiernan Ray
How LangChain turns GenAI into a genuinely useful assistant

The age of AI agents may start with stringing together simple modules that allow for a workflow for real tasks. Cancer diagnosis is just one example.

https://www.zdnet.com/article/how-langchain-turns-genai-into-a-genuinely-useful-assistant/

@LangChainAI
